value: Men and Women Unloading a Fishing Dory, Cullercoats, England

label: Description
value: Horizontal view of side of a boat drawn up on a beach with an indistinct number of men and women unloading it while another woman walks with a bucket of fish on her back; stern of another boat visible at left; small sketch of a boat with a sail, at bottom right.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on tan wove paper, mounted

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

value: Horizontal view of three rectangle, enclosing a single schooner, and two pairs of yawls; also containing two other sketches of sailing craft.

Fisherman and Women Stowing Nets in a Beached Dory, Cullercoats, England

label: Description
value:
Horizontal view of two fishermen, in a beached dory, stowing away a net, which is being fed out by two women standing at the water's edge;a small sailing craft is visible in the distance.

Please note: 1912-12-20-b shows the front of the dory at the extreme right of the image, and extends under 1912-12-20-a.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and white gouache on light-gray wove paper [two sheeets joined, overlapping]

label: Dimensions
value: Overall: 17.6 x 35.8 cm (6 15/16 x 14 1/8 in.) each joined sheet: 17.6 x 27 cm (6 15/16 x 10 5/8 in.) (a)

label: Description
value: Thick charcoal line divides sheet horizontally into two sections. Upper section contains three groups of figures: large, indistinct one at right; woman with two children, center, moving left; and the third group is in chaotic motion, at left; verso: at bottom right are ornamental motifs; at center is a blotter of two very rough sketches of people running, beside a vertical line.
